markers.title: KPI Cards
markers.description: High-level metrics displayed in a clean card layout. Each card shows current value, trend indicator, and comparison to previous period. Quick scan design for executive-level decision making.

markers.title: Revenue Trend Chart
markers.description: Interactive line chart showing revenue trends over time. Supports multiple data series and hover tooltips for detailed values. Chart.js powered for smooth animations.

markers.title: Regional Performance
markers.description: Comparison view of different regions or business units. Color-coded bars make it easy to identify top and bottom performers at a glance.

markers.title: Dashboard Header
markers.description: Consolidated header with key performance indicators and quick filters. Provides context and allows users to customize their view without leaving the page.

markers.title: Multi-Metric Visualization
markers.description: Integrated view combining multiple chart types (line, bar, pie) in a cohesive layout. Designed to tell a complete story in a single view.

markers.title: Financial Charts Panel
markers.description: Left-aligned chart layout optimizes for data exploration. Charts stack vertically for easy comparison and scrolling through detailed financial metrics.

markers.title: Summary Statistics
markers.description: Right sidebar contains summary statistics and insights. Clean separation between visualization and numerical data supports different analysis workflows.

markers.title: Expense Breakdown
markers.description: Detailed expense categorization with interactive filtering. Users can drill down into specific categories to understand cost drivers.

markers.title: Executive Summary Cards
markers.description: High-level KPIs optimized for C-suite. Focus on business outcomes rather than operational details. Large numbers with clear trend indicators.

markers.title: Strategic Insights
markers.description: Narrative-focused insights that tell the story behind the numbers. Designed for board presentations and executive briefings.

markers.title: Full-Width Financial Charts
markers.description: Maximized chart area for detailed financial analysis. Wide format allows more data points and better visibility of trends over extended time periods.

markers.title: Comparative Analysis
markers.description: Side-by-side comparison of financial metrics across centers, time periods, or business units. Makes variance analysis intuitive.

markers.title: Financial Category Tabs
markers.description: Organized financial data into logical tabs (Revenue, Expenses, Profitability, Cash Flow). Reduces clutter while keeping all data accessible.

markers.title: Context-Specific Visualizations
markers.description: Each tab contains charts and metrics specific to that financial category. Optimized layouts for each data type.

markers.title: Sales Funnel Visualization
markers.description: Classic funnel chart showing conversion through sales stages. Width represents volume at each stage, making bottlenecks immediately visible.

markers.title: Conversion Metrics
markers.description: Stage-by-stage conversion rates and drop-off analysis. Helps identify where prospects are lost and where to focus improvement efforts.

markers.title: Pipeline Timeline View
markers.description: Chronological view of all opportunities in the pipeline. Shows expected close dates, deal stages, and revenue projections over time.

markers.title: Revenue Forecast
markers.description: Projected revenue based on pipeline stages and historical close rates. Helps with capacity planning and resource allocation.

markers.title: CRM-Style Pipeline Grid
markers.description: Familiar CRM layout showing all deals with key fields: contact, value, stage, close date. Sortable and filterable for quick analysis.

markers.title: Deal Activity Feed
markers.description: Recent activities and interactions for each opportunity. Tracks communication history and next steps for follow-up.

markers.title: Geographic Expansion Map
markers.description: Visual map showing current coverage and expansion opportunities. Color-coded by market maturity and potential.

markers.title: Market Analysis
markers.description: Detailed metrics for each geographic market: population, competition, regulatory environment, and projected ROI.

markers.title: Regional Supply & Demand Cards
markers.description: Michigan Metro, Indiana Central, and Indiana Northern analyzed for provider availability, ASC coverage, and expansion capacity. Provider:ASC ratios show where resources exist. Indiana Northern's 58% utilization = major opportunity.

markers.title: Provider Density Analysis
markers.description: Providers per 100k population by state. Michigan (14.2) and Indiana (11.8) show strong supply vs Ohio/Illinois border markets. Scatter plot shows relationship between provider availability and ASC coverage.

markers.title: Target Expansion Markets
markers.description: Prioritized market list with provider availability: Indianapolis South (24 available, 0 served), Fort Wayne (18 available, low util), Grand Rapids (32 available). Green = high priority, yellow = recruitment needed.

markers.title: Growth Potential Scores
markers.description: Composite scoring (0-100) combining provider supply, market demand, competition level, and compensation rates. Indianapolis South scores 92—ideal first target for immediate expansion.

markers.title: CRNA vs MD Breakdown
markers.description: Split cards show 198 CRNAs (69%) vs 89 MDs (31%) across Michigan and Indiana. Critical insight: Indiana CRNAs at 66% utilization = 32 FTE untapped capacity. Can support 3-4 new ASCs without recruitment.

markers.title: Provider Mix by Region
markers.description: Stacked bar charts showing CRNA/MD distribution by market. Identifies where provider types are concentrated and where gaps exist for balanced coverage.

markers.title: Clinical Specialty Coverage
markers.description: 9-specialty grid: Orthopedic (68 providers) and GI (52) have excellent coverage. Cardiac (12) and Urology (18) are gaps requiring targeted recruitment for specialty ASC expansion.

markers.title: Specialty Gap Analysis
markers.description: Well-covered specialties ready for expansion vs gaps requiring recruitment. Orthopedic can support 6-8 new ASCs immediately. Cardiac needs +8-10 providers before expanding.

markers.title: Target Market Competitive Intelligence
markers.description: 6 market cards with detailed competitor analysis: Indianapolis South (1 weak competitor, below-market comp), Fort Wayne (Summit Health struggling), Grand Rapids (moderate competition). Color-coded: green=opportunity, yellow=competitive, red=saturated.

markers.title: Competitor Financial Health
markers.description: Real competitive intel: Summit Health lost 2 ASCs in 2025, 28% turnover. RegionalMed has flat growth, below-market compensation. These struggling competitors create expansion openings.

markers.title: Compensation Advantage
markers.description: AAS pays $186K CRNA vs $172K market avg (+8%). $312K MD vs $289K avg (+8%). In Indianapolis South, competitors pay $168K—giving AAS massive recruiting advantage in key expansion markets.

markers.title: 3-Tier Strategic Recommendations
markers.description: Tier 1 (Q1 2026): Indianapolis South, Fort Wayne, Lansing—weak competition, high supply. Tier 2 (Q2-Q3): Grand Rapids, Kalamazoo—moderate competition. Tier 3: Columbus, Ann Arbor—avoid due to saturation.

markers.title: Overtime Hours Metric
markers.description: NEW: Total overtime hours across all centers this week. Provides quick visibility into labor cost overruns and potential staffing issues.

markers.title: Overtime by Center Chart
markers.description: NEW: Color-coded bar chart showing overtime hours by center. Red indicates high overtime (20+ hrs), yellow indicates moderate (15-20 hrs), helping identify centers that may need additional staffing.

markers.title: On-Call Coverage Distribution
markers.description: NEW: Doughnut chart showing current on-call providers by type. Tracks who's actively on-call vs available, ensuring adequate emergency coverage across both MDAs and CRNAs.

markers.title: Provider Allocation with OT Badges
markers.description: Weekly provider schedule showing who's working where. NEW: Red 'OT' badges highlight providers approaching overtime thresholds (Dr. Thompson at 48.5 hrs).

markers.title: Current On-Call Roster
markers.description: NEW: Real-time view of who's currently on-call by region and provider type. Shows when their on-call shift started for rotation tracking and fairness.

markers.title: Overtime Alerts Panel
markers.description: NEW: Active alerts for providers approaching or exceeding weekly hour thresholds. Red alerts (⚠) for critical, yellow (●) for watch list. Helps prevent burnout and compliance issues.

markers.title: On-Call Badges on Calendar
markers.description: NEW: Yellow 'ON-CALL' badges show which providers are on emergency call rotation while working their regular shifts. Helps schedulers avoid double-booking on-call providers.

markers.title: Overtime Indicators
markers.description: NEW: Red 'OT' tags mark shifts where providers are accumulating overtime hours. Visible directly on calendar entries (Dr. Thompson at Riverview) for at-a-glance overtime tracking.

markers.title: On-Call Rotation Schedule
markers.description: NEW: Sidebar panel showing the week's on-call rotation by provider and region. Color-coded by provider type (MDA blue, CRNA green) with next rotation time clearly indicated.

markers.title: Revenue Cycle Process Flow
markers.description: Visual workflow showing patient registration through final payment collection. Identifies handoff points and potential bottlenecks in the revenue cycle.

markers.title: Stage Metrics
markers.description: Key performance indicators at each process stage. Shows where claims get delayed or denied, guiding process improvement efforts.

markers.title: Days in A/R
markers.description: Average days in accounts receivable with trend analysis. Key metric for understanding cash flow and collection efficiency.

markers.title: Collection Rate
markers.description: Percentage of billed amounts successfully collected. Tracks effectiveness of revenue cycle processes and identifies improvement opportunities.

markers.title: Center-by-Center Comparison
markers.description: Revenue cycle metrics compared across all ASC locations. Identifies top performers and locations needing support in billing and collections.

markers.title: Benchmark Analysis
markers.description: Compare AAS performance against industry benchmarks. Shows where we excel and where improvements would have the biggest financial impact.

markers.title: Provider Cards
markers.description: Individual provider profiles in card format. Each card shows key metrics like patient volume, satisfaction scores, and credential status for quick assessment.

markers.title: Performance Metrics
markers.description: Visual indicators of provider performance across multiple dimensions. Supports data-driven decisions about staffing, training, and recognition.

markers.title: Provider Analytics Dashboard
markers.description: Aggregate analytics across provider workforce: utilization rates, productivity trends, compensation analysis. Identifies patterns and optimization opportunities.

markers.title: Workforce Planning Insights
markers.description: Predictive analytics for staffing needs, turnover risk, and capacity planning. Helps anticipate gaps before they become problems.

markers.title: Recruitment Pipeline
markers.description: Track candidates from initial contact through onboarding. Shows stage, timeline, credential status, and next steps for each candidate.

markers.title: Time-to-Fill Metrics
markers.description: Track recruiting efficiency: days to hire, candidate quality, offer acceptance rates. Identifies bottlenecks in the hiring process.

markers.title: Market Demand Analysis
markers.description: Shows where provider shortages exist and recruitment priorities. Links staffing needs to business expansion plans.

markers.title: NPS Score
markers.description: Net Promoter Score with historical trend. Primary measure of ASC client satisfaction and loyalty, tracked over time to measure improvement.

markers.title: Satisfaction Drivers
markers.description: Breakdown of factors influencing ASC client satisfaction. Helps prioritize improvement initiatives by identifying what matters most to clients.

markers.title: Client Feedback
markers.description: Recent ASC administrator comments and survey responses. Qualitative data provides context and specific insights beyond numerical scores.

markers.title: At-Risk ASC Details
markers.description: Critical view: Solaris 3 (satisfaction declined 1.8 points, 3 coverage gaps, billing disputes), Solaris 2 (late callouts), Solaris 1 (weekend challenges). Red=critical, yellow=high risk. Total $3.2M revenue at risk.

markers.title: Churn Risk Indicators
markers.description: Coverage gaps (8.2/10 risk) and billing issues (7.5/10) are top churn drivers. Communication (4.2) and response time (3.5) are strengths. Focus improvement on operational reliability.

markers.title: Action Items by Risk Level
markers.description: Solaris 3: Executive meeting by Nov 30, address billing by Dec 5, assign dedicated account manager. Solaris 2: QBR Dec 8, backup protocol. Solaris 1: Weekend staffing plan, credentialing review.

markers.title: 24-Month Satisfaction Trend
markers.description: Overall satisfaction improved from 8.0 (Dec 2023) to 8.7 (Nov 2025). Steady upward trend shows consistent service improvements. +0.5 YoY, +0.3 last 6 months.

markers.title: ASC System Trends
markers.description: Mini sparklines for major clients: IU Health +0.4 (7 ASCs), Corewell +0.2 (5 ASCs), Beaumont NJ flat (4 ASCs), Solaris -1.2 (3 ASCs). Visual trend identification at a glance.

markers.title: Recent Events & Impact
markers.description: Timeline of key events: IU Health renewal (positive), Corewell coverage improvement (positive), Solaris QBR (neutral), weekend failure (negative). Links events to satisfaction changes.

markers.title: 12-Month System Comparison
markers.description: Line chart shows IU Health climbing to 8.9, Corewell stable at 8.7, Beaumont NJ flat at 8.4, Solaris declining from 9.0 to 7.8. Identifies which relationships need attention.

markers.title: Patient Satisfaction Metrics
markers.description: Overall 4.8/5.0 satisfaction with 68% survey response rate and 96% would recommend. Higher than national average for ASC anesthesia care.

markers.title: Satisfaction Trends
markers.description: 12-month trend shows consistent 4.7-4.9 range. By procedure: Orthopedic (4.9), GI (4.8), ENT (4.7). Identifies which specialties excel in patient experience.

markers.title: Patient Comment Themes
markers.description: Aggregate sentiment analysis: 82% positive, 14% neutral, 4% improvement areas. No individual names—only aggregate data maintains HIPAA compliance while providing insights.

markers.title: Location Performance Cards
markers.description: ASC-by-ASC comparison: Corewell Dearborn leads at 4.9, IU Health West at 4.8. Shows survey volume, trend direction, and key strengths/weaknesses for each location.

markers.title: Satisfaction by ASC Chart
markers.description: Bar chart ranking all 29 ASC locations. Color-coded: green >4.7, yellow 4.5-4.7, red <4.5. Helps identify which locations need support vs which are models.

markers.title: Geographic Patterns
markers.description: Michigan ASCs average 4.8, Indiana 4.7. Regional differences may reflect local culture, case mix, or operational variations. Informs best practice sharing.

markers.title: Quality Performance Indicators
markers.description: Pre-op assessment 99.8%, antibiotic timing 98.5%, airway management 99.9%, PACU handoff 100%, emergency equipment 100%, medication errors 0.02%. All exceed ASA national benchmarks.

markers.title: Patient Safety Metrics
markers.description: Safety score 99.2%, zero adverse events 98.7%, pain control 4.8/5.0. Line chart shows safety improving from 98.8% to 99.2% over 12 months. Exceeds industry benchmark by 1.8%.

markers.title: Post-Op Satisfaction Drivers
markers.description: Most valued: Provider explained risks (4.9), felt safe (4.9), pain managed (4.8). Improvement opportunities: Post-op nausea (4.5), recovery room comfort (4.5), pre-op wait (4.4).

markers.title: Adverse Event Rate
markers.description: AAS rate declining from 2.1 to 1.5 per 1000 cases. National average flat at 3.1. Shows AAS commitment to safety improvement with measurable results.

markers.title: Credentialing Status Dashboard
markers.description: Real-time view of all provider credentials: licenses, board certifications, DEA, malpractice insurance. Red alerts for expiring within 30 days, yellow for 60 days.

markers.title: Expiration Tracking
markers.description: Automated tracking prevents expired credentials. Shows renewal dates, required documents, and workflow status for each provider across all states.

markers.title: Multi-State Compliance
markers.description: Complex tracking for providers working in multiple states. Each state has unique requirements—dashboard ensures nothing falls through cracks.

markers.title: Coding Accuracy Metrics
markers.description: Track coding accuracy rates, denial reasons, and compliance with CMS guidelines. Identifies providers or centers needing additional training.

markers.title: Audit Risk Indicators
markers.description: Monitors patterns that could trigger audits: upcoding flags, modifier usage, documentation gaps. Proactive risk management reduces audit likelihood.

markers.title: Denial Analysis
markers.description: Break down denials by reason code, payer, and provider. Links billing compliance to revenue cycle performance. Informs targeted education.

markers.title: Contract Compliance Tracking
markers.description: Monitor adherence to contract terms: coverage requirements, response times, quality metrics, billing terms. Red flags non-compliance before it becomes breach.

markers.title: Regulatory Risk Assessment
markers.description: Track regulatory changes (Stark Law, Anti-Kickback, state regulations) and assess impact on operations. Ensures proactive compliance adjustments.

markers.title: Renewal Calendar
markers.description: Contract expiration dates with renewal timeline milestones. Prevents last-minute scrambles and allows strategic renegotiation planning.

markers.title: PHI Access Audit Log
markers.description: HIPAA-required audit trail of who accessed patient data, when, and why. Detects unusual access patterns that may indicate breach or misuse.

markers.title: Security Compliance Score
markers.description: Overall HIPAA Security Rule compliance: technical safeguards, administrative policies, physical security. Dashboard shows gaps requiring remediation.

markers.title: Access Control Management
markers.description: Role-based access controls showing who has access to what data. Ensures minimum necessary access principle and tracks terminations.

markers.title: Business Associate Agreements
markers.description: Track all vendors handling PHI: BAA signed status, expiration dates, compliance attestations. HIPAA requires BAAs with every vendor touching patient data.

markers.title: Vendor Risk Ratings
markers.description: Risk assessment for each vendor: security posture, breach history, access level. Prioritizes vendors needing security reviews or contract updates.

markers.title: BAA Renewal Workflow
markers.description: Automated reminders for expiring BAAs. Tracks signature status, legal review, and filing. Prevents gaps in HIPAA coverage.

markers.title: PHI Incident Tracking
markers.description: Log of all potential PHI breaches or security incidents. Tracks investigation status, notification requirements, and corrective actions. Required for HIPAA breach notification.

markers.title: Training Compliance Dashboard
markers.description: Annual HIPAA training completion tracking for all workforce members. Shows completion rates, overdue individuals, and training scores. HIPAA requires annual training.

markers.title: Incident Response Metrics
markers.description: Track time-to-detect, time-to-respond, and time-to-remediate for security incidents. Measures incident response program effectiveness.

markers.title: Scenario Type Tabs
markers.description: NEW: Switch between four scenario types: Hiring Analysis (adding new providers), Rebalancing (moving providers between centers), Case Redistribution (shifting workload), and On-Call Policy changes. Each scenario has unique controls and impact modeling.

markers.title: Interactive Controls Panel
markers.description: NEW: Fully interactive scenario builder with center selection, provider type choice, and parameter sliders. Changes update in real-time across all visualizations. Each scenario has context-specific controls optimized for that analysis type.

markers.title: Impact Summary Cards
markers.description: NEW: Before/after comparison cards showing key metrics: Overtime Hours/Week, Annual Net Impact ($), Coverage Rate, and Provider Workload balance. Delta indicators use color coding (green=improvement, red=concern, gray=neutral) with percentage changes.

markers.title: Overtime Comparison Chart
markers.description: NEW: Bar chart showing current vs projected overtime hours by center. Red bars show current state, green bars show projected state after implementing the scenario. Makes impact visually obvious for quick decision-making.

markers.title: Financial Impact Over Time
markers.description: NEW: Line chart showing cumulative financial impact over 24 months. Accounts for both costs (hiring, relocation) and savings (reduced OT). Break-even point clearly visible where line crosses zero.

markers.title: Auto-Generated Recommendations
markers.description: NEW: AI-style recommendation engine analyzes scenario parameters and generates specific guidance. Considers ROI, break-even timeline, feasibility, and risk factors. Updates dynamically as you adjust controls.

markers.title: Financial Summary
markers.description: NEW: Detailed breakdown of net annual impact and break-even period. Shows exact dollar amounts for decision approval. Color-coded to highlight positive (green) vs negative (red) financial outcomes.

markers.title: Scenario Save & Reset
markers.description: NEW: Save promising scenarios for later comparison or reset controls to start fresh. Allows exploring multiple variations without losing work. (Note: Save feature is demonstration-only in this mockup.)

markers.title: Contract Profitability Scenario
markers.description: NEW: Model how case volume changes, collection rate improvements, and contract floor adjustments impact center profitability and subsidy requirements. Waterfall charts show revenue flow through costs to net margin. Identifies contracts that can become subsidy-free.

markers.title: Market Expansion Scenario
markers.description: NEW: Evaluate expansion into new states with full financial modeling: startup costs, provider headcount requirements, revenue ramp over time, and break-even analysis. State-specific reimbursement rates ensure accurate projections. Cumulative cash flow chart shows when expansion pays off.

markers.title: Provider Turnover Scenario
markers.description: NEW: Model impact of losing providers including recruitment costs, replacement timelines, and coverage strategies (overtime, PRN staff, or reduced coverage). Shows which centers face critical understaffing and burnout risks. Cost breakdown reveals total turnover impact.

markers.title: RCM Optimization Scenario
markers.description: NEW: Calculate ROI of revenue cycle improvements like reduced denials, better collection rates, and improved coding accuracy. Network-wide or center-specific analysis. Shows break-even timeline for RCM investments and annual revenue gains. Identifies which centers benefit most from optimization.

markers.title: Contract Profitability Controls
markers.description: NEW: Interactive sliders for volume change (-30% to +30%), collection rate improvement, and contract floor adjustments. Real-time modeling shows how operational improvements reduce subsidy requirements. Break-even case volume displayed for each scenario.

markers.title: Market Expansion Timeline Slider
markers.description: NEW: Project expansion over 6-36 months with contract acquisition ramp. Provider headcount auto-calculated based on target case volume. Each state has unique reimbursement rates (Illinois $940, Michigan $920, etc.) affecting revenue projections.

markers.title: Multi-Select Provider Turnover
markers.description: NEW: Select multiple departing providers to model cascading impact. High-risk providers (⚠️) highlighted. Choose coverage strategy: overtime (remaining staff), PRN (premium rates), or reduced coverage (revenue loss). Shows time to stabilize operations.

markers.title: RCM ROI Timeline
markers.description: NEW: 24-month projection showing when RCM investment breaks even. Models EMR system costs, denial management FTE, and VB-RCM monthly fees against improved collection revenue. Annual ROI percentage and payback period calculated automatically.

markers.title: Advanced Scenario Modeling
markers.description: NEW: Four additional sophisticated scenarios bring total to 8 interactive models covering finance, strategy, operations, and risk. Each scenario uses real baseline data from 11 centers and 20 providers with accurate cost/revenue calculations. Demonstrates enterprise-grade planning capabilities.
